intro: Galium commune var. collinum, commonly known as mountain bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family.
